definition: bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Between a night, he gets married, the nuptial chamber with her;
sentences.chinese: 一個晚上，他得到之間，洞房花燭結婚。

sentences.english: And here is the palace of Earthly Tranquillity where the emperor and the empress had to spend their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 這是坤寧宮，皇帝和皇后必須在這兒過洞房花燭夜。

sentences.english: A few decades ago, it was commonplace for husbands to expect to see tell-tale red marks on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 幾十年前，新郎們都希望能在洞房花燭夜見紅。

sentences.english: What did you do on the wedding night?
sentences.chinese: 洞房花燭夜你做些什麼？

definition: to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
